rules

Class RulesOf6005

  • java.lang.Object
    • rules.RulesOf6005

  • public class RulesOf6005
extends java.lang.Object
    RulesOf6005 represents the collaboration policy of 6.005 as described by the general information on Stellar.

    • Method Detail

      • mayUseCodeInAssignment

        public static boolean mayUseCodeInAssignment(boolean writtenByYourself,
                                             boolean availableToOthers,
                                             boolean writtenAsCourseWork,
                                             boolean citingYourSource,
                                             boolean implementationRequired)
        Judge whether a given piece of code may be used in an assignment (problem set or team project) or not, according to the 6.005 collaboration policy.
        Parameters:
        writtenByYourself - true if the code in question was written by yourself or, in the case of a team project, your teammates, otherwise false.
        availableToOthers - if not writtenByYourself, whether or not the code in question is available to all other students in the class. Otherwise ignored.
        writtenAsCourseWork - if not writtenByYourself, whether or not the code in question was written specifically as part of a solution to a 6.005 assignment, in the current or past semesters. Otherwise ignored.
        citingYourSource - if not writtenByYourself, whether or not you properly cite your source. Otherwise ignored.
        implementationRequired - whether the assignment specifically asks you to implement the feature in question.
        Returns:
        Whether or not, based on the information provided in the arguments, you are likely to be allowed to use the code in question in your assignment, according to the 6.005 collaboration policy for the current semester.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method of the class. Runs the mayUseCodeInAssignment method.
        Parameters:
        args - unused
